metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4435 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Salt (aka SaltStack) 0.15.0 through 0.17.0 allows remote authenticated users who are using external authentication or client ACL to execute restricted routines by embedding the routine in another routine.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-common - 0.17.5+ds-1
salt-master - 0.17.5+ds-1
salt-minion - 0.17.5+ds-1
salt-ssh - 0.17.5+ds-1
salt-syndic - 0.17.5+ds-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> The announce notes are too difficult to decipher to discover which patches go with which vulnerabilities; there are also some duplicated CVEs and CVE-2013-4437 isn't even mentioned at all,, which makes me think the whole annoucement needs a salt expert to revisit and revise.

criterions.comment: salt package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17.5+ds-1').
